multimonster.common
Class MMThread

java.lang.Object
  multimonster.common.MMThread
public class MMThread
extends java.lang.Object

MMThread is used to create a common way for asynchron execution like it is provieded by a Thread but without violation of the J2EE specification.

Author:
Holger Velke

Constructor Summary
MMThread(java.lang.Runnable target)
          Allocates a new MMThread object so that it has target as its run object.
 
Method Summary
 java.lang.Runnable getRunnable()
          gets the target object which run method should be called.
 void start()
          Strats the execution.
 
Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
 

Constructor Detail

MMThread

public MMThread(java.lang.Runnable target)
Allocates a new MMThread object so that it has target as its run object. A MMThreadBean (MessageDrivenBean) is used to do the asychron execution.

Parameters:
target - the object whose run method is called.
Method Detail

start

public void start()
Strats the execution. It is not assured that the execution starts immediately.

getRunnable

public java.lang.Runnable getRunnable()
gets the target object which run method should be called. This is used by the MMThreadBean to get it's runnable.

Returns:
Returns the Runable of the MMThread.
